summary: Bugbot reviews pull requests and identifies bugs, security issues, and code quality problems. It runs automatically on each PR update or manually when triggered with 'cursor review' or 'bugbot run'.
key_takeaways: Bugbot uses existing PR comments as context to avoid duplicate suggestions.
Autofix can automatically spawn Cloud Agents to fix bugs found during reviews.
Team admins can create rules from the Bugbot dashboard that apply to all repositories.

questions.question: What comment triggers Bugbot to run a review on a PR?
questions.explanation: Comment 'cursor review' or 'bugbot run' on any PR to manually trigger Bugbot. It also runs automatically on each PR update unless configured otherwise.

questions.question: Where should you place BUGBOT.md files for nested project context?

options.text: In .cursor/ directories at any level - Bugbot traverses upward from changed files

questions.explanation: Create .cursor/BUGBOT.md files at any level. Bugbot always includes the root file and traverses upward from changed files to find relevant context (e.g., backend/.cursor/BUGBOT.md for backend files).

questions.question: What requirements must be met for Bugbot Autofix to work?

options.text: Usage-based pricing enabled, a spend limit configured, and storage enabled (not in Legacy Privacy Mode)

questions.explanation: Autofix requires usage-based pricing enabled, a spend limit configured for your team, and storage enabled (not in Legacy Privacy Mode). It uses Cloud Agent credits billed at your plan rates.
